birth_place.zh-cn: 中华民国浙江省海宁县
birth_place.en: Haining County, Zhejiang Province, Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 原名查良镛，香港作家、《明报》创办人。他创作了多部脍炙人口的武侠小说，被誉为20世纪最具影响力的中文作家之一。
description.en: Real name Cha Leung-yung, a Hong Kong writer and founder of Ming Pao. He authored numerous widely popular wuxia novels and is regarded as one of the most influential Chinese-language writers of the 20th century.

description.zh-cn: 金庸的第一任妻子。
description.en: Jin Yong's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 金庸的第二任妻子，新闻工作者，协助金庸创办《明报》。
description.en: Jin Yong's second wife, a journalist who assisted him in founding Ming Pao.

description.zh-cn: 金庸的第三任妻子。
description.en: Jin Yong's third wife.

description.zh-cn: 金庸与朱玫的长子。
description.en: The eldest son of Jin Yong and Zhu Mei.

description.zh-cn: 金庸的父亲，浙江海宁大地主，在镇反运动中被处决。
description.en: Jin Yong's father, a major landowner in Haining, Zhejiang, who was executed during the Campaign to Suppress Counterrevolutionaries.

description.zh-cn: 1950年代初中华人民共和国发起的一场政治运动，旨在肃清其认定的“反革命分子”。
description.en: A political campaign launched by the People's Republic of China in the early 1950s to eradicate elements deemed 'counter-revolutionaries'.

description.zh-cn: 由金庸与沈宝新于1959年在香港创办的中文报纸。
description.en: A Chinese-language newspaper founded in Hong Kong in 1959 by Jin Yong and Shen Pao Sing.

description.zh-cn: 与金庸合资创办《明报》的合伙人。
description.en: Co-founded Ming Pao with Jin Yong.

description.zh-cn: 香港武侠小说家，与金庸相识为友，同为新派武侠小说的开创者。
description.en: A Hong Kong wuxia novelist, a friend of Jin Yong, and a co-pioneer of the 'new school' of wuxia fiction.

description.zh-cn: 1966年至1976年间在中华人民共和国发生的一场大规模社会政治运动，对中国社会造成了深远的影响。
description.en: A large-scale socio-political movement in the People's Republic of China from 1966 to 1976, which had a profound impact on Chinese society.

description.zh-cn: 1967年香港发生的一系列由亲共左派发起的社会骚乱和暴力事件。金庸因在《明报》上谴责暴行而收到死亡威胁。
description.en: A series of social disturbances and violent incidents in Hong Kong in 1967, initiated by pro-communist leftists. Jin Yong received death threats for condemning the violence in Ming Pao.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国第二代主要领导人，曾单独接见金庸，是首位获此待遇的香港人。
description.en: A paramount leader of the People's Republic of China. He was the first PRC leader to grant a private audience to a person from Hong Kong, Jin Yong.

description.zh-cn: 曾任中国共产党中央委员会总书记，于1984年会见过金庸。
description.en: Former General Secretary of the Communist Party of China, who met with Jin Yong in 1984.

nodes.id: 香港特别行政区基本法起草委员会

zh-cn: 香港特别行政区基本法起草委员会
香港基本法起草委员会
en: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Basic Law Drafting Committee

description.zh-cn: 负责起草《中华人民共和国香港特别行政区基本法》的机构，金庸曾任其中委员。
description.en: The body responsible for drafting the Basic Law of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People's Republic of China, of which Jin Yong was a member.

description.zh-cn: 由金庸（查良镛）和查济民于1988年就香港政治体制提出的协调方案，因其保守性而备受争议。
description.en: A controversial and relatively conservative political coordination proposal for Hong Kong's political system, put forward in 1988 by Jin Yong (Cha Leung-yung) and Cha Chi-ming.

description.zh-cn: 香港纺织业大亨，金庸的远房曾叔公，两人曾共同提出“双查方案”。
description.en: A Hong Kong textile tycoon and a distant grand-uncle of Jin Yong. They co-authored the 'Cha-Cha proposal'.

description.zh-cn: 1989年发生在中国北京的抗议示威活动，以武力清场告终。该事件促使金庸辞去基本法草委等职务，结束其从政生涯。
description.en: Protests in Beijing, China in 1989, which ended with a military crackdown. The event prompted Jin Yong to resign from the Basic Law Drafting Committee, ending his political career.

description.zh-cn: 曾任中共中央总书记和中华人民共和国主席，于1993年接见过金庸。
description.en: Former General Secretary of the CPC and President of the PRC, who met with Jin Yong in 1993.

description.zh-cn: 香港商人，于1993年从金庸手中购入明报集团。
description.en: A Hong Kong businessman who acquired the Ming Pao Group from Jin Yong in 1993.

description.zh-cn: 世界顶尖的公立研究型大学，金庸在此获得历史学硕士及博士学位。
description.en: A world-leading public research university where Jin Yong obtained his Master's and PhD in History.

description.zh-cn: 香港著名作家，金庸的好友，曾为金庸代笔撰写《天龙八部》部分章节。
description.en: A renowned Hong Kong writer and a good friend of Jin Yong, who once ghostwrote several chapters of 'Demi-Gods and Semi-Devils' for him.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡出生香港电影人、作家、美食家，金庸的好友，并称为“香港四大才子”之一。
description.en: A Singaporean-born Hong Kong filmmaker, writer, and food critic. He is a good friend of Jin Yong and one of the 'Four Great Talents of Hong Kong'.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期著名文学家，金庸的表兄。
description.en: A renowned writer from the Republic of China era and a cousin of Jin Yong.

description.zh-cn: 国立政治大学在大陆时期的前身，金庸曾在此就读外交系但因不满校内国民党员行为而被退学。
description.en: The predecessor of National Chengchi University on the mainland. Jin Yong studied diplomacy there but was expelled for complaining about the behavior of KMT student members on campus.

description.zh-cn: 金庸于1946年插班修习国际法课程并于1948年毕业的大学。
description.en: The university where Jin Yong enrolled in 1946 to study international law, graduating in 1948.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国浙江省，是金庸的出生地。
description.en: Located in Zhejiang Province, China, it is the birthplace of Jin Yong.

description.zh-cn: 金庸的母亲，在日本入侵华南时举家逃难途中病逝。
description.en: Jin Yong's mother, who passed away from illness while the family was fleeing during the Japanese invasion of Southern China.

description.zh-cn: 1937年至1945年间中华民国与大日本帝国之间的战争。战争爆发导致金庸随学校辗转多地，其母亲亦在逃难中去世。
description.en: The war between the Republic of China and the Empire of Japan from 1937 to 1945. The outbreak of the war caused Jin Yong to move frequently with his school, and his mother died while fleeing.

description.zh-cn: 金庸于1948年与杜冶芬结婚，后于1953年离婚。
description.en: Jin Yong married Du Yefen in 1948, and they divorced in 1953.

description.zh-cn: 金庸于1956年与朱玫结婚，育有二子二女，后于1976年离婚。
description.en: Jin Yong married Zhu Mei in 1956, with whom he had two sons and two daughters, and they divorced in 1976.

description.zh-cn: 金庸于1976年与朱玫离婚后，与林乐怡结婚，直至其逝世。
description.en: After divorcing Zhu Mei in 1976, Jin Yong married Lin Leyi, and they remained married until his death.

description.zh-cn: 金庸于1924年3月10日出生于浙江省海宁县。
description.en: Jin Yong was born in Haining County, Zhejiang Province on March 10, 1924.

description.zh-cn: 徐志摩是金庸的表兄。
description.en: Xu Zhimo was Jin Yong's cousin.

description.zh-cn: 查济民是金庸的远房曾叔公。
description.en: Cha Chi-ming was Jin Yong's distant grand-uncle.

description.zh-cn: 金庸的父亲查枢卿在1951年的镇反运动中被以反革命罪处决。
description.en: Jin Yong's father, Cha Shu-ching, was executed on charges of being a counter-revolutionary during the Campaign to Suppress Counterrevolutionaries in 1951.

description.zh-cn: 1937年日本入侵华南，金庸的母亲徐禄在举家逃难途中不幸病逝。
description.en: In 1937, during the Japanese invasion of Southern China, Jin Yong's mother, Xu Lu, died of illness while the family was fleeing.

description.zh-cn: 1944年考入中央政治大学外交系，后因对校内国民党员行为不满而投诉，反被退学。
description.en: Admitted to the Department of Diplomacy at Central Political University in 1944, but was later expelled after complaining about the behavior of KMT student members.

description.zh-cn: 金庸因对校内国民党员行为不满而向校方投诉，反被退学。
description.en: Jin Yong was expelled after complaining to the school authorities about the behavior of KMT student members.

description.zh-cn: 1946年赴上海东吴大学法学院插班修习国际法课程，1948年毕业。
description.en: Enrolled in the Soochow University School of Law in Shanghai in 1946 to study international law, and graduated in 1948.

degree.zh-cn: 历史学哲学硕士、哲学博士

description.zh-cn: 2005年起在剑桥大学深造，先后取得历史学硕士及博士学位。
description.en: Pursued advanced studies at the University of Cambridge from 2005, obtaining both an MPhil and a PhD in History.

description.zh-cn: 1959年，金庸与沈宝新合资创办《明报》。
description.en: In 1959, Jin Yong co-founded Ming Pao with Shen Pao Sing.

description.zh-cn: 1959年，沈宝新与金庸合资创办《明报》。
description.en: In 1959, Shen Pao Sing co-founded Ming Pao with Jin Yong.

description.zh-cn: 朱玫以其新闻从业经验协助丈夫金庸创办《明报》。
description.en: Zhu Mei used her journalistic experience to assist her husband Jin Yong in founding Ming Pao.

description.zh-cn: 金庸在《新晚报》工作期间与同事梁羽生相识为友。
description.en: Jin Yong befriended his colleague Liang Yusheng while working at the New Evening Post.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命爆发时，金庸和《明报》公开对其持反对态度，因此被香港左派斥为“汉奸”、“走狗”。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Jin Yong and Ming Pao openly opposed it, leading to him being denounced as a 'traitor' and 'running dog' by Hong Kong leftists.

description.zh-cn: 金庸因在《明报》社评中谴责六七暴动，受到死亡威胁并被列入暗杀名单，被迫暂时离港避居新加坡。
description.en: Jin Yong condemned the 1967 Hong Kong riots in Ming Pao's editorials, which led to death threats and his inclusion on an assassination list, forcing him to temporarily flee to Singapore.

description.zh-cn: 1981年，金庸在北京与时任中华人民共和国领导人邓小平会谈，成为首位获邓小平单独接见的香港人。
description.en: In 1981, Jin Yong met with then-PRC leader Deng Xiaoping in Beijing, becoming the first person from Hong Kong to be granted a private audience by Deng.

description.zh-cn: 1984年，金庸访问中国大陆时与时任中共中央总书记胡耀邦会谈。
description.en: In 1984, during his visit to mainland China, Jin Yong met with then-CPC General Secretary Hu Yaobang.

relationships.target: 香港特别行政区基本法起草委员会

position.zh-cn: 委员、政治体制起草小组港方负责人
position.en: Member, Hong Kong Co-convenor of the Political Structure Sub-group

description.zh-cn: 1985年，金庸成为香港基本法起草委员会委员，后因六四事件于1989年辞职。
description.en: In 1985, Jin Yong became a member of the Hong Kong Basic Law Drafting Committee, but he resigned in 1989 following the Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 1988年，金庸与查济民共同提出了关于香港政制发展的“双查方案”。
description.en: In 1988, Jin Yong and Cha Chi-ming jointly proposed the 'Cha-Cha proposal' regarding Hong Kong's political system development.

description.zh-cn: 1988年，查济民与金庸（查良镛）共同提出了关于香港政制发展的“双查方案”。
description.en: In 1988, Cha Chi-ming and Jin Yong (Cha Leung-yung) jointly proposed the 'Cha-Cha proposal' regarding Hong Kong's political system development.

description.zh-cn: 1989年六四事件发生后，金庸辞去基本法草委、咨委职务，结束了其从政生涯。
description.en: After the 1989 Tiananmen Square incident, Jin Yong resigned from his posts on the Basic Law Drafting and Consultative Committees, ending his political career.

description.zh-cn: 1993年两会期间，金庸赴北京访问并获时任中共中央总书记江泽民接见。
description.en: During the Two Sessions in 1993, Jin Yong visited Beijing and was received by then-CPC General Secretary Jiang Zemin.

description.zh-cn: 金庸于1993年将明报集团售予于品海，并宣布全面退休。
description.en: In 1993, Jin Yong sold the Ming Pao Group to Yu Pun-hoi and announced his full retirement.

description.zh-cn: 倪匡是金庸的好友，曾在金庸外游时为其代笔《天龙八部》。
description.en: Ni Kuang was a good friend of Jin Yong and ghostwrote parts of 'Demi-Gods and Semi-Devils' for him while he was traveling abroad.

description.zh-cn: 蔡澜是金庸的好友，两人同被列为“香港四大才子”。
description.en: Chua Lam was a good friend of Jin Yong, and they were both known as one of the 'Four Great Talents of Hong Kong'.
